Utterance: Hi there! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey! I’ve been okay. I actually started journaling like we talked about.
That’s fantastic! How has that experience been for you?
It’s been surprisingly helpful. I didn’t think I’d enjoy it, but it feels good to just write everything down.
I’m glad to hear that! What kinds of things have you been writing about?
Mostly about my feelings and some of the things that happened during the week. It’s nice to let it all out.
That’s a great way to process your emotions. Have you noticed any patterns or insights from your entries?
Yeah, I’ve realized that I tend to get angry when I feel overwhelmed or like I’m not in control.
That’s an important realization. Recognizing triggers is a big step toward managing your emotions. How do you feel about that insight?
It makes sense. I guess I just need to find ways to cope better when I start feeling that way.
Absolutely. What coping strategies have you tried so far when you feel overwhelmed?
I’ve been working out more, and journaling definitely helps. But I still struggle sometimes.
It’s okay to struggle; it’s part of the process. Have you thought about any additional techniques, like mindfulness or deep breathing exercises?
I’ve heard of mindfulness but never really tried it.
Mindfulness can be a powerful tool for grounding yourself in the present moment. Would you like to explore some techniques together?
Sure, that sounds interesting!
Great! One simple technique is focusing on your breath. Let’s try it together for a moment.
Okay.
Close your eyes if you feel comfortable. Take a deep breath in through your nose… and out through your mouth. Let’s do that a few times.
*breathes deeply*
As you breathe, notice any sensations in your body. If your mind starts to wander, gently bring your focus back to your breath.
*continues breathing*
When you’re ready, you can open your eyes. How did that feel for you?
It was nice. I felt a little more relaxed.
That’s wonderful! Practicing mindfulness regularly can help you manage stress and anger more effectively. Would you like to incorporate this into your routine?
Yeah, I think I will.
Excellent! Let’s also touch on your music. Have you written any new songs since our last session?
I did! I wrote one about feeling lost and trying to find my way again.
That sounds powerful. What inspired that theme?
Just some feelings I’ve been having. It felt good to express it in a song.
Music can be such a therapeutic outlet. How does it feel to share those emotions through your art?
It feels freeing, like I’m not holding anything back.
That’s a beautiful way to express yourself. Have you thought about performing your music or sharing it with others?
I’ve thought about it but not sure if I’m ready for that.
That’s completely understandable. Sharing your art can be vulnerable, but it can also be rewarding. Perhaps you could start by sharing it with your close friends?
That might be a good idea. I’ll think about it.
Great! It’s all about taking small steps. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I guess I’m still curious about my anger and how to handle it better.
That’s a valuable topic. Have you had any situations recently where you felt your anger rise?
Yeah, actually. I got into a disagreement with a friend about something trivial, and I felt myself getting really worked up.
How did you handle that in the moment?
I took a step back and tried to breathe, which helped a bit. But I still ended up snapping at them.
It’s a positive sign that you recognized your feelings and tried to manage them. What do you think you could do differently next time?
Maybe I could try to communicate my feelings better instead of just reacting.
That’s a great insight. Practicing assertive communication can help you express your feelings without escalating the situation. Would you like to role-play a scenario to practice?
Sure, that could be helpful.
Let’s say you’re in a disagreement with your friend. You can start by expressing how you feel and what you need.
Okay, um… “I feel frustrated when…”
Perfect start! Continue from there.
“I feel frustrated when you dismiss my opinion. I need us to find a solution together.”
That’s a strong and clear way to express yourself. How did that feel to say?
It felt good, like I was actually standing up for myself.
That’s the power of assertive communication! Practicing this can lead to healthier interactions.
I’ll definitely keep that in mind.
Excellent! As we wrap up today’s session, what goals would you like to set for our next meeting?
I want to keep journaling, practice mindfulness, and maybe try that communication technique with my friends.
Those are fantastic goals! I look forward to hearing about your progress next time.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate everything.
You’re very welcome! Take care until we meet again.
Bye!
